title: HPI Spencer
content: Chaz Thomas presented for follow-up after taking off his splint due to exposure to someone else's blood. He reported some pain and limited flexion.
Meesha Senuda reported improvement in sensitivity and stiffness of the PIP joint but continued to experience some stiffness.
Grace Twan presented for MRI review following an IM Kenalog injection for a mass and other aches and pains.
Charles Shaw reported doing well overall with minimal pain and okay with his bulky dressings.
Josefina Marcial reported her right hand pain improved after an injection and is considering treatment for her left wrist.
instruction: Summarize HPI as a single paragraph.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Laceration clean, dry, intact with sutures removed; some pain, limited flexion.
Significantly limited flexion at DIP joint; stiffness but able to flex to 90 degrees; minimal tenosynovitis distally; hypersensitivity distally.
Exam unchanged.
Mild laceration to proximal nail folds; can protect within asterisks.
Bilateral upper extremity skin clean, dry, intact without erythema or erosion; moderate tenosynovitis at DRUJ; bilateral ulnar prominence; limited motion bilaterally.

title: Imaging Results
content: MRI results reviewed.

title: Assessment
content: Laceration healing with sutures removed; pain and limited flexion.
PIP joint stiffness improving.
Mass and systemic symptoms.
Mild laceration to proximal nail folds.
Wrist arthritis; tenosynovitis.

title: Plan
content: Transition to removable splint; initiate hand therapy; follow-up in two weeks.
Discontinue splint entirely; continue home exercise program; follow-up in six weeks.
Discuss with Dr. Sidlow about medical control; follow-up in three months or sooner if excisional biopsy desired.
Continue protecting with soft dressings; keep clean and dry; follow-up in one week.
Trial of night splints; home exercise program; consider injection if no improvement.
